    portfolio

    Angular momentum transfer from swift electrons to non-spherical nanoparticles within the dipolar approximation

    Building on previous dipolar approximation methods, we extended angular momentum transfer calculations to non-spherical nanoparticles.

    Recipe Collection

    A personal compilation of recipes, maintained as a LaTeX document for clean typesetting and easy updates.

    publications

    Angular Momentum Transfer from Swift Electrons to Small Spheroidal Nanoparticles in the Dipole Approximation

    Published in Microscopy and Microanalysis, 2023

    Poster presentation on angular momentum transfer from swift electrons to spheroidal nanoparticles.

    Download Paper

    Modeling Electron Energy Loss and Momentum Transfer in Swift Electron Interactions with Small Polyhedral Nanoparticles

    Published in Microscopy and Microanalysis, 2024

    Poster presentation on energy loss and momentum transfer from swift electrons to polyhedral nanoparticles using numerical polarizability methods.

    Download Paper

    Angular momentum transfer from swift electrons to non-spherical nanoparticles within the dipolar approximation

    Published in Ultramicroscopy, 2024

    We investigate how nanoparticle geometry influences angular momentum transfer from swift electrons using a classical electrodynamics framework within the dipolar approximation.

    Download Paper | Download Bibtex

    Exploring Momentum Transfer in Electron Microscopy: Size and Material Effects on Nanoparticle Resonances

    Published in Microscopy and Microanalysis, 2025

    Poster presentation investigating how nanoparticle size and material composition affect momentum transfer from swift electrons.

    Download Paper

    Implementation for Efficient Numerical Computation of Electron Beam Momentum Transfer Driven by Optical Excitations in Large Spherical Nanoparticles

    Published in Frontiers in Optics, 2025

    Poster presentation on efficient numerical methods for computing optical excitation-driven momentum transfer in electron-nanoparticle interactions.

    Download Paper

    Linear momentum transferred from a swift electron to a large spherical nanoparticle

    Published in Preprint, 2026

    New methodology for efficiently computing linear momentum transfer to nanoparticles up to 50 nm radius using fully causal electrodynamics.

    teaching

    Electromagnetic Phenomena (2020-1)

    Undergraduate course, UNAM, Facultad de Ciencias, 2019

    I served as a teaching assistant for this undergraduate electromagnetic phenomena course, supporting students in understanding concepts in electromagnetism.

    Electromagnetism II (2020-2)

    Undergraduate course, UNAM, Facultad de Ciencias, 2020

    I served as a teaching assistant for this undergraduate electromagnetism course, supporting students in understanding advanced concepts in electromagnetism.

    Electromagnetism I (2021-2)

    Undergraduate course, UNAM, Facultad de Ciencias, 2021

    I served as a teaching assistant for this undergraduate electromagnetism course, supporting students in understanding basic concepts in electromagnetism.

    Electromagnetism II (2022-1)

    Undergraduate course, UNAM, Facultad de Ciencias, 2021

    I served as a teaching assistant for this undergraduate electromagnetism course, supporting students in understanding advanced concepts in electromagnetism.
